Love to live these adventures, from the eye perspective of Morgan Freeman.

This is the second part of 2 to one of the greatest single-person games on the planet, personally i wish they would of taken more time to make this a better installment in the series. it was to fast and not ready for what type of comp hardware that is out now. its a short game that all but stall you at the end of the road. gonna say yes because its half-life and no because valve should of taken more time to make this better game and experience for all including the CULT followers. this game was a let down for me personally. When i was around the age of six i played the 1st half-life and it changed my world forever. then when HL2 hit it was like a much needed refresh that claimed back the shooter genre.. i love this game but this was the shortest game i've ever played and i enjoy spending time when it worth it so why couldn't Valve? what it because of steam? the world will never know and will never see the next installment because of it.
[spoiler] Valve, please give us the Half Life 3. I've been waiting for 13 years.... [/spoiler]

Binge played from HL1 to this, did not get bored or feel like it was grindy at all, enjoyed the story as well.  

I typically do not like FPS games.

Fortunately for me I waited 22 years to start playing so my wait for HL3 will be 13 years shorter than those who played @ launch.
It's a Half-Life game, what more do you need to know?

Bought it for mounting with Garry's Mod, but was still impressed by the story.
this is a great game, i found this really enjoyable

Another great contiuation of the half life series. This game is much better than epsiode 1 in many aspects. it¬¥s longer, it¬¥s has more mechanics, more enemies, more unique enviroments, and just more half life in general. The advisors are actually quite terrifying, with how they look with their long, white, veiny, sticky and long dong tongue. and what they can do, with gravity and penetrating their dong tongues through your body, making a new "hole". The saddest thing with this game is the finale of the episode. Eli vance dies in the hands of the advisors, and alyx lies on the ground, holding her father while shedding many tears and grieving for god knows how long now. Merle did a fantastic performance as usual, especially at the end. It really sounded like she was actually crying. 9/10 i highly recommend.

HL2-2
Fly lamar to the moon!

This is easily the best of the episodic "trilogy", the story is built upon expertly. I was genuinely excited when I heard the name of a familiar science enterprise. The gameplay is as anyone would expect of a game titled Half Life, fun. The visuals, while dated, hold up rather well considering when this came out and is completely overshadowed by how invested you will get when playing. The existence of HL : Alyx gives me hope that we can finally get the sequel that has become more of a myth with time.
One of the most legendary games ever made!
